title: Formula
text: Keep in mind that the formula to calculate the mean of a binomial distribution is Mean $$=$$ np, where n $$=$$ Total Trials and p $$=$$ The Probability of Success.

title: Variables
text: What is n (total trials) going to be for this problem? What about p (probability of success)? As it turns out, n $$=$$ 80 and p $$=$$ .613.

title: Answer
text: Knowing our equation for calculating our answer along with our variables, what is our final answer going to be?
